mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Martha Washington to Frances Bassett Washington, 1794 August 3
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Martha, 1731-1802
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Martha Washington writes from German Town. Comments on the death of a son of Dr. and Mrs. James Craik -- Mrs. Harrison and children in German Town for their health -- will send Fanny's shoes and mattress by packet to Mt. Vernon -- President says she may use broad or narrow boards, whichever she prefers -- Bartholomew Dandridge is sick -- they came to German Town for his health and President's -- the spot on Washington's face doesn't seem to respond to medicine -- Nelly has returned from her jaunt. Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, laminated, part of George Washington's watermark. Name on original manuscript appears as "M. Washington".
